content.title: Aaws Bhatta Sahayata Yojana
content.beneficiary: Economically disadvantaged students belonging to Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes
content.details: The Awas Bhatta Sahayata Yojana is a scheme under the Higher Education Department of the Government of Madhya Pradesh to provide assistance to economically disadvantaged students belonging to Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes. It aims to support students who have to rent accommodation near their college due to the distance from their homes. Under this scheme, financial aid is provided to help cover rental expenses, thereby easing the burden on students pursuing higher education and ensuring equitable access to educational opportunities for marginalized communities in the state.
benefits: In Bhopal, Indore, Jabalpur, Gwalior, and Ujjain cities ₹2,000/- per student per month.
At district headquarters ₹1,250/- per student per month.
At the tehsil and development block level ₹1,000/- per student per month.
eligibility: The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste category.
The applicant must be admitted as a regular student in a government or recognized non-government college.
The applicant must not be admitted to any government hostel.
The annual income of the student's family must be as per the income limit prescribed in the Post Matric Scholarship Scheme, which is currently ₹6,00,000/- per annum.
The college or the student's permanent residence should not be located within the geographical limits of the same local body (urban body/gram panchayat).
documents_required: Certificate of the class in which the student is studying.
Certificate of Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe (the category to which the student belongs).

faqs.question: What is the Awas Bhatta Sahayata Yojana?
faqs.answer: The Awas Bhatta Sahayata Yojana is a government scheme in Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Poor students belonging to Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes are eligible.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to assist students who have to rent accommodation near their colleges due to distance from home.

faqs.question: Which areas are covered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: It covers cities like Bhopal, Indore, Jabalpur, Gwalior, Ujjain, and district headquarters.

faqs.question: How much financial aid do students receive in major cities?
faqs.answer: Students receive ₹ 2000 per month in major cities.

faqs.question: Is the scheme specific to a particular academic level?
faqs.answer: The scheme primarily targets students pursuing higher education.

faqs.question: Is the scheme exclusive to Madhya Pradesh?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Awas Bhatta Sahayata Yojana is specific to the state of Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: Can I apply offline?
faqs.answer: As per the guidelines, the scheme can be filled only online.

faqs.question: Is this scheme for both boys and girls?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for both boys and girls.

faqs.question: What is Samagra ID?
faqs.answer: In Madhya Pradesh, the Samagra ID is a unique nine-digit number given to residents, making it easier for them to use government services and benefits.
